meanings.definition: The process of forming or regenerating epithelial tissue.
meanings.sent1: Epithelization is crucial for the healing of skin wounds.
meanings.sent2: The doctor observed the epithelization of the patient's skin after the surgery.
meanings.sent3: The rapid epithelization of the cut was like watching a time-lapse video.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like the epithelization of a new layer of skin.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight helped speed up the epithelization of the plant's leaves.

meanings.definition: The growth of epithelial cells to cover a wound or surface.
meanings.sent1: Proper care can promote epithelization and prevent infections.
meanings.sent2: The nurse monitored the epithelization of the burn to ensure proper healing.
meanings.sent3: The bandage seemed to encourage the epithelization process.
meanings.sent4: The rapid epithelization of the wound was a relief to the patient.
meanings.sent5: The ointment helped speed up the epithelization of the scraped knee.

meanings.definition: The development of epithelial cells in a specific area.
meanings.sent1: The epithelization of the lining of the stomach is essential for digestion.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the epithelization of cells in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected epithelization of the skin caught everyone by surprise.
